(Simplified: 夹)
Ideographic: Two people 从 supporting someone 大 from either side
purpleculture_examples:
夾雜 [ jiā zá ]: to mix together (disparate substances); to mingle; a mix; to be tangled up with
夾擊 [ jiā jī ]: pincer attack; attack from two or more sides; converging attack; attack on a flank; fork in chess, with one piece making two attacks
夾攻 [ jiā gōng ]: attack from two sides; pincer movement; converging attack; attack on a flank; fork in chess, with one piece making two attacks
夾子 [ jiā zi ]: clip; clamp; tongs; folder; wallet
夾道 [ jiā dào ]: a narrow street (lined with walls); to line the street
夾襖 [ jiá ǎo ]: lined jacket; double layered jacket; Classifiers: 件
夾腳拖鞋 [ jiá jiǎo tuō xié ]: flip-flops

jiā: (сущ) папка, зажим, держатель

humanum_full_description_en:
There are two theories about the configuration of " clip ", one is like the shape of a person holding two people under the armpit (Xu Shen, Huang Xiquan), and the other is like the shape of two people holding one person (Lin Yiguang, Gao Hongjin), two The original meaning of the configuration of this argument is clamping, and the extension means support and assistance. Add the word " pinch " next to the " hand ".

The oracle bone inscriptions or provinces are in the shape of a person under the armpit. "Shuowen": "Clip, Chiya. From two heroes." Duan Yucai changed to "Cong Dajia two."

Inscriptions on the inscriptions indicate auxiliary, Dazhuding: "The death of the edict (corpse) 𤔲rong", Yu Ding: "The first king of the edict built the four directions", "The Twenty-sixth Year of the Zuo Zhuan • The Thirty-sixth Anniversary The femoral perihumeral chamber is the king."
humanum_short_description_en: Inscriptions from " big " to two " persons ", one is like the shape of a person holding two persons under the armpit (Xu Shen, Huang Xiquan), and the other is like the shape of two persons facing each other and one person (Lin Yiguang, Gao Hongjin) The original meaning of the second statement is clamping, and the extension means support and assistance. Add the word " pinch " next to the " hand ".
humanum_full_description:
「夾」的構形有兩說，一說象一人腋下夾二人之形(許慎、黃錫全)，另一說象二人相向夾一人之形(林義光、高鴻縉)，兩種說法的構形本義皆是夾持，引申表示扶持、輔佐。後加「手」旁造「挾」字。

　　甲骨文或省作腋下夾一人之形。《說文》：「夾，持也。从大俠二人。」段玉裁改為「从大夾二人」。

　　金文表示輔佐，大盂鼎：「迺詔夾死(尸)𤔲戎」，禹鼎：「克夾詔先王奠四方」，《左傳•僖公二十六年》：「昔周公、太公股肱周室，夾輔成王。」
humanum_short_description: 甲金文從「大」從二「人」，一說象一人腋下夾二人之形(許慎、黃錫全)，一說象二人相向夾一人之形(林義光、高鴻縉)，二說的本義皆是夾持，引申表示扶持、輔佐。後加「手」旁造「挾」字。

①從兩旁鉗住：使勁兒夾住。
②兩旁有物限制住，在兩者之間：兩山夾一水。夾峙。
③攙雜：夾生飯。夾雜。
④夾東西的器具：竹夾子。夾剪。卷(ju僴)夾。

「 夾 」的構形有兩說，一說象一人腋下夾二人之形(許慎、黃錫全)，另一說象二人相向夾一人之形(林義光、高鴻縉)，兩種說法的構形本義皆是夾持，引申表示扶持、輔佐。後加「 手 」旁造「 挾 」字。 甲骨文或省作腋下夾一人之形。《說文》：「夾，持也。从大俠二人。」段玉裁改為「从大夾二人」。 金文表示輔佐，大盂鼎：「迺詔夾死(尸)𤔲戎」，禹鼎：「克夾詔先王奠四方」，《左傳•僖公二十六年》：「昔周公、太公股肱周室，夾輔成王。」
There are two theories about the configuration of " clip", one is like the shape of a person holding two people under the armpit (Xu Shen, Huang Xiquan), and the other is like the shape of two people holding one person (Lin Yiguang, Gao Hongjin), two The original meaning of the configuration of this argument is clamping, and the extension means support and assistance. Add the word " pinch" next to the " hand". The oracle bone inscriptions or provinces are in the shape of a person under the armpit. "Shuowen": "Clip, Chiya. From two heroes." Duan Yucai changed to "Cong Dajia two." Inscriptions on the inscriptions indicate auxiliary, Dazhuding: "The death of the edict (corpse) 𤔲rong", Yu Ding: "The first king of the edict built the four directions", "The Twenty-sixth Year of the Zuo Zhuan • The Thirty-sixth Anniversary The femoral perihumeral chamber is the king."

夾字的基本解释

夾
jiā

夾
jiá

夾
gā

夾
xiá
均见“夹”。

夾字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jiā］
［《廣韻》古洽切，入洽，見。］
“俠2”的被通假字。“夹1”的繁体字。
(1)从左右相持或相对。
(2)从两个相对的方面施加作用。亦指置于胳膊底下或手指等中间。
(3)钳夹用具。
(4)辅佐。
(5)掺杂；连带。
(6)夹室。
(7)港汊。
(8)量词。
(9)棋类术语。
[②]［jiá］
［《集韻》吉協切，入帖，見。］
“夹2”的繁体字。
(1)双层的。
(2)弓名。参见“夾2弓”。
(3)通“鋏”。剑柄。
(4)夹衣。
(5)姓。《汉书·艺文志》载，《春秋》有《夹氏传》十一卷。颜师古注：“夾音頰。”
[③]［gā］
“夹3”的繁体字。
[④]［xiá］
通“狹1”。“夹4”的繁体字。
窄。
[⑤]［xié］
［《集韻》檄頰切，入帖，匣。］
通“挾1”。“夹5”的繁体字。

夾字的康熙字典解释

【丑集下】【大字部】　夾； 康熙笔画：7； 页码：页250第10
【廣韻】【集韻】【正韻】古狎切【韻會】訖洽切，?音甲。左右持也。【書·多方】爾曷不夾介乂我周王。【左傳·僖二十六年】夾輔成王。　又近也。【書·梓材】懷爲夾。【註】懷遠爲近也。　又兼也。【呂温狄仁傑頌】潛授五龍，夾日以飛。　又梵夾。【通鑑】唐懿宗於禁中設講，自唱經，手錄梵夾。　又鉗夾，巧言膠固也。【柳宗元·乞巧文】膠如鉗夾。　又【集韻】【韻會】吉協切【正韻】古協切，?音頰。傍也，把也。夾弓，見【周禮·夏官註】。往體多，來體寡曰夾。　又劒夾。【陶弘景·刀劒錄】商孔甲採牛首山鐵，鑄一劒，銘曰夾。　又【集韻】檄頰切，音協。【說文】俜也。　又姓。【前漢·藝文志】有夾氏春秋。　又同狹。【後漢·東夷傳】東沃沮，其地東西夾，南北長。　【六書正譌】从二人，从?省。二人對輔于肘?之下，會夾意。

夾字的源字形

字源演变：

甲骨文金文楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
夾字的起名意思

暂无。

[①]［jiā］
["Guangyun" Ancient Qiaqi, enter Qia, see you. ]
"Xia 2" is a false word. The traditional characters of "夹1".
(1) Stake or oppose each other from left to right.
(2) Act from two opposite sides. It also means to be placed under the arm or in the middle of the fingers.
(3) Clamping tools.
(4) Assistant.
(5) Doping; associative.
(6) Clipping room.
(7) Hong Kong Branch.
(8) Quantifiers.
(9) Chess terms.
[②]［jiá］
["Ji Yun" Ji Xie cut, enter the post, see. ]
The traditional characters of "夹2".
(1) Double-layered.
(2) Bow name. See "Clamp 2 Bow".
(3) Through "clamp". Hilt.
(4) Clipping.
(5) Last name. "Han Shu·Yi Wen Zhi" contains eleven volumes of "Jia Shi Biography" in "Chun Qiu". Yan Shigu's Note: "Picting the cheeks."
